properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - LEICHHARDT Norton Street between Allen Street AND Marion Street
properties.publicTransport: Local bus routes will be diverting around the closure and missing some stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held on Norton Street in Leichhardt on Sunday from 10am to 6pm.

From 8am to 8pm, the following closures will be in place:

  • Norton St between Allen St and Marion St
  • Lou St between Marlborough St and Allen St

Managed access for local residents will also be in place on local roads surrounding the event, follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect from 6am to 8pm on both sides of Norton St between Macauley St and Marion St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - SUMMER HILL Lackey Street between Carlton Crescent AND Smith Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held on Lackey St in Summer Hill on Saturday from 10am to 6pm.

From 8am to 8pm, the following roads will be closed:

  • Lackey St between Carlton Cres and Smith St
  • Smith Street between Hardie Ave and Nowranie St
  • Sections of Hardie Ave car park will also be closed from 6am to 8pm.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect from 6am to 8pm on both sides of the following roads:

  • Lackey St between Carlton Cre and Smith St
  • Smith St between Hardie Ave and Nowranie St
  • Morris St between Smith St and 1A Morris St

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

webLinks.linkText: Vivid Sydney 2022 - Interactive road closure maps

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney - SYDNEY CBD, CIRCULAR QUAY, THE ROCKS, WALSH BAY, BARANGAROO George Street, Hickson Road, Pitt Street, Loftus Street
properties.publicTransport: On Friday to Sunday nights buses in Circular Quay will be relocated to stops at Martin Place. On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm Light rail services will not run between Town Hall and Circular Quay. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 12th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 27 May to Saturday 18 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night. 

Traffic is expected it to be very heavy in the city over the June long weekend, so if you're planning your visit to Vivid Sydney please catch public transport and avoid the traffic delays. If you must drive, arrive early ahead of lights on to avoid the congestion as car parks will reach capacity through the evenings.

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St and Railway Colonnade at Central Station.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St closed from Grosvenor St to Essex St.  

Fridays

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Hickson Rd eastbound from Towns Place to Pottinger St and Railway Colonnade at Central Station.
  • 6pm – midnight: roads north of Bridge St at Circular Quay including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St from Grosvenor St to Essex St.  

Saturdays and Sunday (12 June) of the long weekend 

  • 5pm – 1am: closures in the Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay including sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St, Jamison St, Margaret St, Hunter St, George St north of King St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Hickson Rd eastbound from Towns Place to Pottinger St, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets at Circular Quay, and Railway Colonnade at Central Station. No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets on Saturday nights.

Sundays and Mon 13 June (public holiday)       

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Grosvenor St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Hickson Rd eastbound from Towns Place to Pottinger St, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets at Circular Quay, and Railway Colonnade at Central Station.

Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal will be closed each day during Vivid Sydney from 3pm until midnight (until 1am on Saturdays). Closures will also be in place on Wheat Rd and Darling Drive at Darling Harbour from 5.30pm to midnight on Friday-Sunday nights.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

  • Railway Colonnade between Pitt St and Railway Colonnade roundabout
  • Reiby Pl between Loftus St and Pitt St
  • Young St between Alfred St and Bridge St Eastern side
  • Young St 1 between Alfred St and Bridge St Western side

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Pitt Street, Loftus Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney - DARLING HARBOUR Wheat Road, Darling Drive
properties.publicTransport: On Friday to Sunday nights buses in Circular Quay will be relocated to stops at Martin Place. On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm Light rail services will not run between Town Hall and Circular Quay. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: VIVID 2022 Level 1 with insert Communications A3P v5.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Monday to Thursdays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Fridays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Fridays - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sundays and Monday 13 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sundays and Monday 13 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Saturdays and Sunday 12 June - Vivid Sydney road closure & clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 12th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 27 May to Saturday 18 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect around Darling Harbour on Friday nights and weekends.  

Traffic is expected it to be very heavy in the city over the June long weekend, so if you're planning your visit to Vivid Sydney please catch public transport and avoid the traffic delays. If you must drive, arrive early ahead of lights on to avoid the congestion as car parks will reach capacity through the evenings.

Road closures on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and Monday 13 June - from 5.30pm to midnight:

  • Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour
  • Darling Dr between Ultimo Rd and Pier St roundabout

Roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks will also close each night from 5pm to midnight, and until 1am on Saturday nights. 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on both sides of Wheat Rd from 4.30pm to midnight.

Clearways will also be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the CBD on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

webLinks.linkText: Taronga Zoo - Vivid Sydney Wild Nights

properties.headline: Vivid Sydney Taronga Zoo - MOSMAN Bradleys Head Road, Military Road approaching Taronga Zoo
properties.publicTransport: Ticketholders are encouraged to catch public transport as parking at the Zoo and in surrounding streets is very limited. Ferries and buses run regularly to Taronga Zoo from the city and north shore. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney’s iconic Tarong Zoo will light up during Vivid Sydney for two ticketed sessions at 5.30pm and 7.30pm on Wednesday to Sunday nights including public Holiday Monday. Pre-purchased event tickets are required.

No planned road closures or special event clearways will be in place around Taronga Zoo during Vivid however traffic will be heavy.

Motorists should expect delays on Military Rd, Spit Rd and Bradleys Head Rd as attendees travel to sessions starting at 5.30pm and 7.30pm.

Commuters are advised to allow additional travel time through Mosman during the evening peak on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights during Vivid.

properties.headline: State of Origin - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on transport. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
State of Origin Game I at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Kick-off from 8.10pm, finishing around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as nearly 80,000 fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game from as early as 1am, see the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

**Car parks sold out for State of Origin**: all available parking spaces at Olympic Park are sold out for State of Origin on Wednesday 8 June. Catch public transport instead or park at a station commuter car park and connect with frequent trains to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked a parking space, follow signage and directions of staff to your allocated spot.

If you're driving from the north, use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access to precinct car parks and avoid heavy traffic expected on Homebush Bay Drive and Underwood Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Religious Procession - SYDNEY CBD Hunter St, Macquarie St, College St
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Religious Procession 19 June - Sydney CBD Road Closure and Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Religious Procession 19 June - Sydney CBD Road Closure and Clearway Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in effect for the Walk with Christ Religious Procession in the Sydney CBD between 2.30pm and 4.30pm from Martin Place to St Marys Cathedral.

Traffic will be heavy in the city while roads are closed. Motorists should avoid unnecessary travel through the city where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures:

  • From 2:30pm to 4:30pm – sections of Pitt, O'Connell, Bligh, Castlereagh, Phillip, King, Elizabeth, George and Hunter Streets will close.
  • From 2:50pm to 4:30pm – sections of College St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd and St James Rd will close.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm until 4pm on sections of College, Hunter, Macquarie and Pitt Streets. Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 2.30PM TO 4.30PM

  • Bligh Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place
  • Castlereagh Street between Hunter Street and King Street
  • Elizabeth Street between Market Street and King Street (northbound only)     
  • Elizabeth Street between King Street and Hunter Street
  • George Street between Margaret Street and Hunter Street (southbound only)
  • Hunter Street between George Street and Pitt Street (eastbound only)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street
  • King Street between Phillip Street and Elizabeth Street
  • O’Connell Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street      
  • Phillip Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street 
  • Phillip Street between Hunter Street and King Street      

FROM 2.50PM TO 4.30PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and Park Street      
  • Macquarie Street between Bent Street and St James Road    
  • Prince Albert Road between Macquarie Street and St Mary’s Road
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Macquarie Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones that apply to all vehicle types, and to local residents, businesses or Transport for New South Wales Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 1PM TO 4PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and William Street (eastern side)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street (both sides)
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street (western side)
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place (eastern side)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures and Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Hunter St, Macquarie St, College St

webLinks.linkText: Event website - Festival of the Fleeces

properties.headline: Community festival - MERRIWA Golden Highway between Marquet St AND Dutton St
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place on Saturday for the Merriwa Festival of the Fleeces ‘Running of the Sheep’ parade being held from 7am to 3pm.

The Golden Hwy will be closed between Dutton St and Marquet St from 6am to 5pm.

Motorists will be detoured around the highway closure via Marquet St, Blaxland St and Dutton St.

Motorists travelling through Merriwa over the long weekend should allow extra travel time and expect delays.

properties.headline: NRL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

arrangementAttachments.fileName: SCO_1080_MOORE PARK WALK_17DEC21_NO SHUTTLES OR EP2.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Storm at the SCG. Kick off from 5:30pm and full-time around 7:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match from 4pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access the EP3 Southern grass car park (open from 2:30pm) or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling via the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 9pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 9PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.headline: Stakes Day - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. Gates open at 10am. First race at 11am and last race at 4:25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Panthers at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 4:05pm and full time approx. 6:05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Sea Eagles at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. NRL kick-off from 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: NRL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Eels at Accor Stadium. NRL kick-off from 5:30pm, full-time around 7:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are urged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Wine Festival - GERRINGONG Willowvale Road at Crooked River Wines
properties.otherAdvice:
Winter Wine Festival will be held at Crooked River Wines in Gerringong on Saturday and Sunday from 11am to 8pm each day. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Princes Hwy, Belinda St and Willowvale Rd as festival goers travel to and from the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Rabbitohs at WIN Stadium. Kick off from 7:50pm, full-time around 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: NRL - BROOKVALE Pittwater Road at Brookvale Oval
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Cowboys at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 6pm, full-time around 8pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: AFL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching GIANTS Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Bulldogs at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce around 7:25pm, finishing at approx. 9:55pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11.59pm the night before).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Roosters at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:35pm and full-time around 9:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close from 9:20pm until 10pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Wests Tigers at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 4:05pm and full-time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Bookmakers Recognition Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse from 11am.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Concert - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Entertainment Centre
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Human Nature concert at WIN Entertainment Centre. Show start from 8pm and finish approx 10.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Sports and Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the concert. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - CHIPPENDALE Kensington Street between Broadway AND Outram Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Street Party event will be held on Kensington St on Friday from 11am to 11:30pm.

Fron 11am until 11:30pm Kensington St will be closed between Broadway and Outram Street to accommodate the event. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Comedy Show - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road approaching Chatham Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Jim Jefferies live at Newcastle Entertainment Centre, doors open from 7.30pm with support act from 8.30pm. Show finishes around 11pm.

Motorists are advised to expect delays on Griffiths Rd approaching Newcastle Entertainment Centre before and after the show.

Right hand turns from Griffiths Rd into the venue may be restricted, causing delays for some motorists. Left hand turns into the venue will not be impacted.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow directions from Police and traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Police Operation - SYDNEY CBD Macquarie Street between Hunter Street AND St James Rd, Sydney
properties.publicTransport: Route 200 buses will be diverting around Macquarie St and missing stops at Martin Place, check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD between 10.25am and 12pm for a planned Police Operation protest march.

Macquarie St will be closed between St James Rd and Hunter St. Short term closures will be in place on sections of St James Rd and Prince Albert Rd.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.
